isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - REMOVE - CAB DOORS

svcsubproc.title: Remove Front Cab Door on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models
svcsubproc.para: Doors are of all steel-welded construction. The front door is mounted on hinges located on the front cab hinge pillar and door adjustment is provided by enlarged holes in front cab door hinge. Door check stop is located just below upper hinge on the front cab door hinge pillar. Front cab door latch striker pin is also adjustable on front cab door lock pillar. Service on the door and its components is covered in sections which follow.
Refer to Figure 36 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove door wiring harness rubber boot (Item 1) from the cab hinge pillar (Item 2), driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 36. Door Wiring Harness Rubber Boot

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 37 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Reach up under the instrument panel to the left of the steering wheel an locate wiring harness coming from the front door, pull cab door wiring harness (Item 1) down to access connectors (Item 2), driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 37. Door Wiring Harness and Connectors

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 38 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once access to the connectors is accomplished, disconnect CB radio cable connector (Item 1), electric window and electric door lock wiring harness connector (Item 2) and lighted, heated or electric mirror wiring harness connector (Item 3), if so equipped, driver side shown.

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. ELECTRIC WINDOW AND DOOR LOCK CONNECTOR
3. LIGHTED, HEATED OR ELECTRIC MIRROR CONNECTOR

step1.para: Use a sling or padded chain through top of window opening and attach sling to an overhead hoist to support front cab door.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 39 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove front cab door check stop pin (Item 1) from front cab door check link (Item 2) and front cab door check bracket (Item 3), driver side shown.
Remove four hex nuts with washers (Item 4) from threaded studs (Item 5) of front cab door (Item 6), driver side shown.
Slide four threaded studs (Item 5) of front cab door (Item 6) out of upper and lower front cab door hinges (Items 7 and 8), driver side shown.
Carefully pull the wiring harness and connectors of front cab door (Item 6) through front cab door hinge pillar.
Using overhead hoist move front cab door (Item 6) to a padded work bench, or cover with a material that will not scratch painted surfaces of the door a work bench or other suitable support.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. FRONT CAB DOOR CHECK STOP PIN

step1.para: Repeat procedure to remove passenger side front door.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Rear Cab Door on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models
svcsubproc.para: Doors are of all steel-welded construction. The rear cab door is mounted on hinges located on the cab B pillar and door adjustment is provided by enlarged holes in rear cab door hinge. Rear cab door check stop is located just below upper rear cab door hinge on the cab B pillar. Rear cab door latch striker pin is also adjustable on rear cab door lock pillar. Service on the door and its components is covered in sections which follow.
Refer to Figure 36 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove door wiring harness rubber boot (Item 1) from the cab hinge pillar (Item 2).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 40 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove torx head bolt (Item 1) securing shoulder belt D - ring (Item 2) to the B pillar trim panel (Item 3), driver side shown. Lay shoulder belt and D - ring out of the way, discard the D - ring torx head bolt. A new torx head bolt is required at installation.

figure.caption: Figure 40. Shoulder Belt D - ring on B pillar Trim Panel

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 41 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove push-in fastener (Item 1) securing the seat belt retractor cover (Item 2) to the seat belt retractor bracket, driver side shown. Save push-in fastener for installation.
Remove torx head screw (Item 3) nearest the B pillar securing the rear door seal plate (Item 4) to the cab floor, driver side shown. Save torx head screw for installation.

figure.caption: Figure 41. Seat Belt Retractor Cover and Rear Door Seal Plate

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 42 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Using a removal tool (Item 1), remove six push-in fasteners (Item 2) from the B pillar trim panel (Item 3), driver side shown. Lay push-in fasteners out of the way and save for installation.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 41 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Lift seat belt retractor cover (Item 2) and rear door seal plate (Item 4) up enough to allow removal of B pillar trim panel. Lay B pillar trim panel out of the way and save for installation.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 43 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Disconnect cab wiring harness electrical connector (Item 1) from cab door wiring harness electrical connector (Item 2), driver side shown.
Disconnect cab door light switch connector (Item 3) from cab wiring harness light switch connector (Item 4), driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 43. Rear Cab Door Wiring Harness and Connectors

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. CAB DOOR WIRING HARNESS ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR
4. CAB WIRING HARNESS LIGHT SWITCH CONNECTOR

step1.para: Use a sling or padded chain through top of window opening and attach sling to an overhead hoist to support rear cab door.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 44 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove rear cab door check stop pin (Item 1) from rear cab door check link (Item 2) and rear cab door check bracket (Item 3), driver side shown.
Remove four hex nuts with washers (Item 4) from threaded studs (Item 5) of rear cab door (Item 6), driver side shown.
Slide four threaded studs (Item 5) of rear cab door (Item 6) out of upper and lower rear cab door hinges (Items 7 and 8), driver side shown.
Carefully pull the wiring harness and connectors of rear cab door (Item 6) through B pillar.
Using overhead hoist move rear cab door (Item 6) to a padded work bench or other suitable support, or cover with a material that will not scratch painted surfaces of the door.

figure.caption: Figure 44. Crew Cab Rear Cab Door and Crew Cab Rear Cab Door Hinge

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. REAR CAB DOOR CHECK STOP PIN

step1.para: Repeat procedure to remove passenger side rear door.
